intro: Ischaemum hubbardii, commonly known as Hubbard's barnyardgrass, is a species of grass native to North America. It is a member of the Poaceae family and typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and agricultural fields. The plant has slender, erect stems with narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet that is usually positioned at the tip of the stem. Ischaemum hubbardii is characterized by its small, pale green to brown seeds and is often considered a weed in cultivated areas.
